definitions.text: a regular route for a sentry or policeman
examples: in the old days a policeman walked a beat and knew all his people by name

definitions.text: the rhythmic contraction and expansion of the arteries with each beat of the heart
examples: he could feel the beat of her heart

definitions.text: the basic rhythmic unit in a piece of music
examples: the piece has a fast rhythm

definitions.text: a single pulsation of an oscillation produced by adding two waves of different frequencies; has a frequency equal to the difference between the two oscillations
a member of the beat generation; a nonconformist in dress and behavior
the sound of stroke or blow
examples: he heard the beat of a drum

definitions.text: (prosody) the accent in a metrical foot of verse
a regular rate of repetition
a stroke or blow
examples: the signal was two beats on the steam pipe

definitions.text: the act of beating to windward; sailing as close as possible to the direction from which the wind is blowing
come out better in a competition, race, or conflict
examples: Agassi beat Becker in the tennis championship
Harvard defeated Yale in the last football game

definitions.text: give a beating to; subject to a beating, either as a punishment or as an act of aggression
examples: Thugs beat him up when he walked down the street late at night
The teacher used to beat the students

definitions.text: hit repeatedly
examples: beat the table with his shoe

definitions.text: move rhythmically
shape by beating
make a rhythmic sound
glare or strike with great intensity
examples: The sun was beating down on us

definitions.text: move with a thrashing motion
examples: The eagle beat its wings and soared high into the sky

definitions.text: sail with much tacking or with difficulty
examples: The boat beat in the strong wind

definitions.text: stir vigorously
strike (a part of one's own body) repeatedly, as in great emotion or in accompaniment to music
be superior
avoid paying
make a sound like a clock or a timer
move with a flapping motion
indicate by beating, as with the fingers or drumsticks
move with or as if with a regular alternating motion
examples: the city pulsated with music and excitement

definitions.text: make by pounding or trampling
examples: beat a path through the forest

definitions.text: produce a rhythm by striking repeatedly
strike (water or bushes) repeatedly to rouse animals for hunting
beat through cleverness and wit
be a mystery or bewildering to
examples: Got me--I don't know the answer!

definitions.text: wear out completely
examples: This kind of work exhausts me
He was all washed up after the exam

definitions.text: very tired
examples: was all in at the end of the day
so beat I could flop down and go to sleep anywhere
I'm dead after that long trip
